intro: Huberantha jenkinsii, commonly known as the Jenkins' huberantha, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and emits a mild, sweet fragrance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
